}} 'John Murphy' (born 4 March 1965) is an English film composer. He is a
self-taught multi-instrumental musician who began his career in the 1980s
working notably with The Lotus Eaters, Thomas Lang, Gary Wall (singer) and
Claudia BrÃ¼cken.

Murphy is best known for composing the music for Guy Ritchie's [[Lock, Stock and
Two Smoking Barrels]], Michael Mann's [[Miami Vice (film)|Miami Vice]], Matthew
Vaughn's [[Kick-Ass (film)|Kick-Ass]], and the Danny Boyle films [[28 Days
Later]], [[Millions]], and [[Sunshine (2007 film)|Sunshine]]. His instrumental
tracks "In the House â In a Heartbeat" and "Adagio in D Minor" have been
featured in a variety of TV shows, commercials and film trailers.
